name: Hotel Borgo del Mare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for One night before joining Navigator of the Seas for a weeks cruise, the hotel was of a good quality (fairly basic, not UK 4* perhaps a good 3* - but clean and modern rooms - no pool which is a shame). The rooms are spacious and have clearly been recently modernised and come with sky tv which you can switch a large selection of the channels in to English. This was something we really appreciated as there is not a lot to do in Civitavecchia, particularly where the hotel is - in fact the area the hotel is in has very few redeeming features. The gentleman at reception (I think probably the owner) was very helpful and recommended as we had plenty of time to kill we should head into the promenade area near the port which has had a recent make over, as well as having several bars and restaurants. As we had arrived early in the day we took up his suggestion and took a taxi down there (be aware taxi’s are very expensive - 15 euros for a 3km drive on the way down and 10 euros for the return). The area was pleasant for a couple of hours and we had excellent pizza in a restaurant recommended by the hotel for lunch.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for a Nights stay before a Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about the hotel was its restaurant on an evening, if you choose to dine there you will be in for a treat with some excellent Italian cooking at a very reasonable price, we had a 4 course meal for 30 euros each and it was all of the highest quality, with excellent friendly service. Although I would not recommend staying in Civitavecchia for a full day if you need a hotel near the port for a night this is the place to stay, just for the food alone.
reviews.title: Thankfully it was only for one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note the hotel also offers a free shuttle to take you to your ship in the morning which is very handy and a small continental breakfast is available.
reviews.title: Convenient Overnighter Only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled by train from Rome to Civitavecchia. The queue for tickets at Rome's Termini were very long but they now have a number system which makes it a little less hassle. We needed platform #27 which is so far away you feel you're walking to Civitavecchia!! We went to validate our tickets before boarding the train. All at once a young lad rushed up saying he would help us with the tickets - tried to carry our luggage - help us onto the train etc. He was very persistant but we got rid of his unwanted attention by giving him a 2 Euro tip which was far less than he wanted and he complained bitterly to no avail!! Apparently these young gypsies - boys and girls - are active all over the stations in Italy. Beware!
reviews.title: Convenient overnight stop prior to cruise embarkation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We caught a taxi from Civitavecchia station to the hotel which was about 2 kilms away from the port area where we were due to join our cruise the following day. The room was very small, there was no kettle/coffee/tea in the room, the shower was broken, only one sheet to cover us on the bed, and the bed itself was a very small double which made you fear you would fall off it during the night! In fairness they do mention the small bed but I didn't notice it at the time of booking. Although the hotel looks as though it's near the sea in fact you can't walk down to the sea as it is a built up area. The hotel has a small restaurant where we ate as there was nowhere else to go in the area. The breakfast was also extremely poor. The hotel is listed as 4 star but our experience would give it 2 star maximum. The only positive point I would make is that they run a shuttle service in the mornings from the hotel directly to your cruise ship. Other than that feature I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Godd Spot For PRE or POST Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group of 8 spent the night at this hotel after our cruise but before our Tuscany tour. The hotel is nice...very clean with good size rooms. The restaurant for dinner was excellent. However, you are not near the town or shops in the area. Just a small cafe on the corner which did not have very good sandwiches. We walked the few blocks to the sea & climbed the rocks overlooking the water which was very pretty. All in all a nice comfortable place to stay for a pre or post cruise.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A family owned lovely small hotel. This was our second stay in a year. The hotel is still clean and well kept. Family members man the front desk and are very friendly and helpful. Transportation is provided to the port. We love the courtyard and quiet area.
reviews.title: Sedcond stay at lovely pre cruise hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is very good and the food is delicious.
reviews.title: Reasonable and nice pre-cruise hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel the night before embarking on a cruise; although it had changed names in the interim. The rates are reasonable, and our ground floor room was quiet, relatively spacious and had a better than average bathroom for a three star hotel in Europe. Civitaveccia is a long way (a 50 minute drive) from the Rome airport (FCO), and the hotel's van price for transporting us at 110 Euros was actually below the rates quoted by other providers; expecially when one considers that we arrived at 10:00 P.M. and had to wait 45 minutes for our luggage. The van driver was still cheerful at that hour. Breakfast the next day was typical and pretty decent. We knew how to find our way to a shopping area about 20 minutes walk, so we could get Euros from an ATM and buy wine for on board at a local,and therefore reasonaly priced, grocery store. The van carried us and our luggage, along with that of two other cruise bound couples, to the ship without charge, and it is not a short distance. One would not use this hotel to see the (very limited) sights of Civitaveccia, but one does not go to that city for sightseeing, or or to sample fine Italian dining anyway. Actually, you can walk down to te sea from the hotel if you have time and the weather is cooperative. The staff is friendly and helpful. If we ever return for the same reason, we will use tghis hotel for the third time.
reviews.title: Great Pre-Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a gem of a small hotel located in a residential area. The hotel staff was polite, friendly and willing to help in any way possible. The outdoor courtyard was a delightful place in which to enjoy a beverage and interact with other guests. The hotel was located within walking distance of the sea and local restaurants. The hotel restaurnat was delightful with a nice menu and fine selections. Our group of 4 couples enjoyed the dining experience and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Our Post cruise experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly, clean hotel in a quiet location and an ideal place to stay if you want peace and quiet after a flight. Easy to find if travelling by car. Rooms were adequate but could do with a little fresh decoration. The hotel provides an efficient shuttle service from Rome airport, and also from the hotel to the port. The hotel always answered our e-mail questions promptly prior to our arrival, and were always extremely helpful. Complimentary breakfast was very good, and evening meals are available.
reviews.title: Pre-cruise stay instead of Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: One disadvantage on our trip was that the shuttle bus did not go to the port after 12 am (something worth finding out about in advance from the hotel). We had to take the shuttle at that time although we did not embark the ship until 4o'clock. The hotel could not quarantee getting us a taxi at a later time, the receptionist explained that there are only a few taxis in Civitavecchia, and they could be quite expensive.
reviews.title: Rome Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and would use it again in the future.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Did a three-day pre-cruise stay in Civitavecchia, Italy in June. Hotel provided a shuttle to pick us up at the Rome airport for a nominal fee which we considered reasonable. Staff were very friendly and most spoke English. Rooms were spotless and well maintained. On site restaurant served a complimentary breakfast which is good. Also had dinner there one evening and considered it good as well. Provided free shuttle to cruise ship. The only negative is the hotel is about a mile from the center of town and the train station. Without a vehicle, it is either a taxi ride or a good doable walk to both locations. Highly recommend in order to save $ from expensive Rome hotels. A train ride to Rome is $12 r/t. and takes approximately 1 hr 15 min.
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay before and after cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff, every single person, was helpful and courteous. As some of the previous raters mentioned, this hotel is more like a 3-star but the staff make it a 5+ star! The rooms are cleaned very thoroughly and you can smell the clean when you walk in. The hotel (and the rooms) is relatively small, but typical of most European hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property prior to our cruise in May. It was a pleasant stay with comfortable clean accommodation and a friendly staff at front office. Computor was available at front office and the provided breakfast was good. We would recommend this property highly. Included shuttle to port was efficient and well run.
reviews.title: borgo del mare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel with some freinds before embarking on a cruise. Having booked the hotel with Booking.com we contacted the hotel to arrange a transfer from the airport to the hotel on the eveing of our arrival. They picked us up promptly from the airport and we were warmly greeted by the freindly and helpful staff. The room, on the first floor, was small but adequate for one night and very clean. The hotel is situated about a 25 minute walk out of town in a quiet spot. Breakfast was a simple Italian affair with excellent chocolate cake!
reviews.title: Ideal Pre cruise hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel transferrred us free of charge right to the ship at our requested time despite being busy. We even arranged for them to transfer us from the ship to the airport on our return which they did without a hitch. This is a very good option for freinds travelling together as they will charge a flat rate for a small minibus.
reviews.title: Very Nice - Very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there after our cruise for one night.
reviews.title: Good but limitations

reviews.title: Wonderful!

description: Hotel Borgo del Mare, a 4 star hotel opened in 2008, is Civitavecchia hospitality benchmark. Located at 2 Kms from the centre and the port, it is the perfect accommodation for those who like hush but want to stay in town. All its rooms are finely finished off and provided with telephone, mini bar, safe, air-conditioning, Wide screen LCD TV with Sky pay-per-view, some of them with a wonderful sea view. The hotel restaurant will delight you with local delicatessen in an elegant and welcoming environment
